medical_history.chief_complaint: Diagnosis of Pseudoxanthoma elasticum (PXE) with characteristic skin lesions and ocular findings.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The first skin lesions were noted at age 7, with angioid streaks appearing later. The skin manifestations progressed over the years in various family members, with notable delays in diagnosis, averaging about 9 years.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Previous diagnosis of PXE at age 14 years; characteristic skin lesions noted from age 7.
medical_history.family_history: Family history included two brothers and a father with no apparent PXE signs, but the mother showed subtle ocular findings. Other family members have varying degrees of PXE manifestations.
